result.execSummary:
The defendant Judith A Townsend was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable as follows:  $200.00 due today.  Balance of fine and costs payable at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting on December 15, 2015 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Judith A Townsend

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: sent another copy of JOC showing amount owed and copy of all receipts to defendant

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 1.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties she plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights and entered her plea.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 1.  Joint recommendation for:  $100, plus costs.  Defendant did not elect to exercise her right to allocution.  Court ordered the same.  Pay $200.00 today. Balance @ $50.00/mo starting 12/15/15.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Attorney Poss requests the seized firearm be returned.  Court will allow exchange with a family member, not the defendant.
Received email from Attorney Poss that he and ADA Inlow have resolved case and requested to remove Status from 9/14/15 and set a Plea and Sent date of 10/19/15 @ 1:30PM.

ADDRESS INFO for Judith A Townsend

Prior: 4565 Marshall Road, Brookston, MN 55711

Pre-trial conference at 08-26-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 09-14-2015 03:00 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through authorization.  Attorney Poss appeared in person.  Reading of the complaint waived.  PTC & STC dates set.  bond continued.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared without counsel.  Defendant did not contact attorney yet.  Defendant wants an attorney.  Go to SPD today.  AIA set for 8/3/15 at 9:30 am.  Other options for representation explained.  Bond continued.

Judith Townsend called @ 2:00 p.m. to state she is proceeding pro se; explained she can contact SPDO or if want court may appt attorney for her or she can hire one; no she will come to hearing and ask where to find information & why she is being charge with crime; explained that court may not be able to advise her she said she knew what she was talking about

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:victim A. J.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Bond set.  AIA set for 7/13/15 at 9:30 am.  Defendant to contact SPD ASAP.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:victim A. J.
